casebody.data:
People v. Stock et al. (Common Pleas of New York City and County, General Term. April 7, 1890.) Application to vacate judgment against John Stock, principal, and Thomas Cunningham, surety, on forfeited recognizance.

Argued before Larkemobe, C. J., and Daly and Bischoff, JJ.

Townsend & Mahon, for petitioners. J. R. Fellows, for the People. Daly, J.

The application should be granted, as it appears that the principal was surrendered after the forfeiture of the recognizance, and was tried and convicted, and sentenced to pay a fine for his offense,—the violation of a corporation ordinance. All concur.
